On 6/7/11 5:02 AM, nch2012 wrote:
> Hi,
> I am trying to build the latest version available of heritrix.
> The link
> http://builds.archive.org:8080/maven2/org/archive/heritrix/heritrix/3.1.0-beta/heritrix-3.1.0-beta-dist.tar.gz
> seems to be down.

Yes, the 'builds.archive.org' machine is still having issues and the 
full replacement is still being prepared. The very latest H3 development 
builds are available from the new Jenkins-based build box, accessible 
for now at:

https://ia410225.us.archive.org:1443/

Generally if you would have been comfortable with the 3.1.0-beta a 
3.1.0-SNAPSHOT would be appropriate too (and we always appreciate the 
help testing the latest code in preparation for an official release).

> Is this the last version available? With subversion I downloaded heritrix3, is it older than heritrix 1.14.4?
> Why are two numbering sequences being used? I mean "heritrix 1, 2, 3" and then also "heritrix 1.14.3, 1.14.4...."

Roughly changes to the leading digit (eg "1.", "2.", "3." aka "major 
version") mean there are big, backward incompatible changes that users 
of previous editions will want to understand before upgrading. Changes 
to the second digit (eg "1.12", "1.14", "3.0", "3.1" aka "minor 
version") indicate some new functionality but generally painless 
transitions forward if you familiarize yourself with the Release Notes 
for the releases between what you're using and what you're moving to. 
Changes to the third digit (eg "1.14.1", "1.14.2", "1.14.3" aka "micro" 
or "patch" or "point release") mean mostly fixes and small changes, and 
often (but unfortunately not always) configurations can be brought 
forward with no conscious effort.

Even as later major versions are developed, some people can't move right 
away, so small fix point releases will continue on the earlier major 
version. (Heritrix 2 went through a second major configuration change 
after its first release, but before any widespread adoption, so 
essentially everyone using Heritrix should be on either 1.14.x or 3.0+ 
and no other H2 point releases are expected.) Our expected next few 
official releases are:

3.1.0 final
1.14.5
3.1.1

There will probably eventually be a 1.14.6 if institutions keep using it 
and there are necessary fixes that accumulate, but there probably won't 
be a 1.16.0.

At this point, people starting fresh who can handle XML-based 
configuration editing, or people doing their own code customizations in 
Java, are urged to start with a Heritrix 3 release. People on projects 
that already have experience with Heritrix 1 and are used-to or more 
comfortable with its form-fields-based configuration can wait until they 
feel they need something in H3.


> I am going crazy with the gzip problem: I cannot get nutchwax to import any arc produced by heritrix. Is this gzip problem solved in 3.1.0? I am using jdk1.6.0_25

The latest dev builds (including 3.1.0-beta and the 3.1.0-SNAPSHOT 
builds on the new build machine referenced above) have a workaround for 
the GZIP-reading issues introduced by JDK6u23-and-above. If you can get 
your nutchwax version to use the latest (W)ARC-reading code, which may 
take a little work, it should resolve your issues. Or, you could go back 
to JDK6u22 or earlier.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA

> Thanx in advance to anyone who might help.
> Nacho
